text: UPDATED: OCT 27, 2016 Sweet, grassy, deep woods aroma. Fairly complex flavor with fresh grain, a little orange liqueur, and caramel. There is a lingering, cooling bitterness in the finish. I do wonder what makes this a traditional ale and not some type of pale ale. Another very good VT beer.

From the can. Orange, heady pour with decent clarity. I get a touch of mango and floral characters in the aroma. The body is medium and almost creamy. The taste has the same mango or juicy fruit flavors with a mild to moderate bitter ending.
Can shared at Todds. Dank nose and hoppy dank body with light color low malt. Solid.

16oz can gift from dlovell2. Dark golden slight haze with big white head. Sweet fruity tropical and citrus hop aroma. Big hoppy Vermont explosion of flavor up front: mango, orange, grapefruit, passion fruit and some pine. Finish has plenty of lingering bitterness and a medium malt feel. Thanks!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can pours out crisp golden topped with a sand head. Nose is nice pincers citrus hops a rich caramel malts. Taste is more of the pine some tropical fruit sweetness and a grapefruit bitterness on the end.

Poured from 16 oz can purchased at Joes Discount Beverage in Springfield. Pours cloudy golden web a white head. Aroma is fresh pineapple, mango, citrus, and dank pine resin. Flavor is citrus followed by pineapple and mango. Finishing with grapefruit and pine resin. Very dry brew with lots of tropical fruit. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 Nez dabricots séchés et de grains. Robe orangée ornée dune petite mousse. Goût de houblon torréfié avec des notes de pamplemousse et de pin. Texture un peu huileuse. Rafraîchissante, lorsque bien froide. Rendue un peu plus tiède, ses accents torréfiés sont plus forts.

Great hop aroma with mango tangerine and grapefruit with mild malt to smooth it out. Super hazy dense golden color with hues of Orange, one finger white head that dissipates fairly quickly with nice lacing. Nice smooth pineapple, mango, and grapefruit flavors with superb bite from the hops pine resin finish. Creamy medium body with quick to flat like carbonation. Love the all hop flavor and creamy smooth body awesome IPA. keep brewing those narly brew, love them all.
Bottle. Pours golden orange with a thin white head.Aroma of pine & citrus. Flavor was lightly bitter with pale malts, pine, citrus and light fruit.

This was poured into a nonic pint glass.
The appearance was a soft hazy orange color with a light transparency about it. Subtle carbonation is seen rising at a moderate pace. There was about a fingers worth of subtle white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. Lacing was few and far between.
The smell started off dried pine bitter and sweet through nice crisp tones.
The taste was basically the same as the aroma with a semi-dry to crisp aftertaste leading to a decent bitter bite in the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionable feel to it. Carbonation hits the spot allowing the bitterness to be the harshness hitting my tongue appropriately.
Overall, as an AIPA it works. Id have this again.

New England Bucket List Trip Beer #108. Keg at the brewery. Pours a clear golden amber with a medium sized creamy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of floral, citrus, herbal hops, pale malt. The taste matches. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness.

Draft at Capones. Pours mostly clear with minimal head. Nose is very nice with tropical and stone fruits. First sip is similar with mild bready notes. Finish is slightly dry. Best beer from Rock Art.

Bottle from Brewfest. Gold with chill haze lasting white head and lace. Nice citrus and fresh dank aroma. Mild tropical fruity sweetness hints of honey with dank fresh hoppy bitterness and dry spicy finish. Lively carbo and medium light body. Best beer from these guys. Excellent. Get it while it is fresh.

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark yellow with a big creamy white lasting head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of pine, citrus and caramel. Lightly bitter as well as sweet, average carbonation, light body, thin to oily texture feel, flavors of biscuit, hay and light maltyness leading to a lightly brief bitter finish. Nicely balanced.
